description: From Middle English losel (also lorel), from *losen, loren, past participle of lesen (“to lose”), equivalent to lose +‎ -le.

adjectives.description: losel (comparative more losel, superlative most losel)

entries.meaning: (archaic) A worthless or despicable person, scoundrel.
examples: Lots of folk live on their wits: / Lecturers, lispers, / Losels, loblolly-men, louts— / They don't end up as paupers; […]
